content.description: Stand start on the large split rail. Go up and right to a side pull block then bump to another large crimp. Small feet to an overhanging top out / mantel.
content.protection: Pads good - tall top out is one of the cruxes but landing is flat and soft
content.location: Quality Boulder is uphill from Pimp Juice another 5-10 min. Walk slightly up and left along the the edge of the big rock formation. Turn right and up at the the last gully. I always know it’s the right one bc there is a pretty large boulder with a flat face staring at you on top of other boulders.

content.description: Left side of boulder. Using crack to get up the bulge and then topout after grabbing dog dish.

Stand Start to the left of the little tree. Right hand on a side pull flake, and left hand on either a little brown hold with the circle hole in it, or on the far left crack around the corner.

Find a couple tiny foot holds and launch up to some decent dishes or crimps. Then work your way up along the left rail.

Definitely the launch up is the hardest move - feels great to stick bc how small left hand and feet are.

Best descent is on the opposite side - the black face.
content.protection: One pad fine for this one
content.location: Quality Boulder is uphill from Pimp Juice another 5-10 min. Walk slightly up and left along the the edge of the big rock formation. Turn right and up at the the last gully. I always know it’s the right one bc there is a pretty large boulder with a flat face staring at you on top of other boulders.

content.description: Sit start to down and the the right of Quality Jr.
content.location: On Quality Jr. Boulder (the boulder behind Quality Boulder)

content.description:
Are we in the Buttermilks!? This classic line starts on an

obvious left hand dike crimp then heads up on small crimps and gastons. If it were in Bishop then it would probably be V7.
content.location: 15 minutes uphill from Pimp Juice, the beautiful south face is obvious. One of the most amazing positions in South Lake. Make the hike! It's worth it!
